intro: Hydrocotyle araucana, commonly known as the Araucaria hydrocotyle, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
